name: Aloo Pyaaz (Spiced Potato Onions)
description: Aloo Pyaaz and Bhaji with Roti/Chapati (spiced potato onion vegetable stew with Indian bread). So delicious served as a main course.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 teaspoon coriander seeds ((the red onions and coriander seeds work magic for this dish))

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium deep pan, and add the oil and heat on medium heat for a minute.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium deep pan, and add the oil and heat on medium heat for a minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the mustard and coriander seeds and let them cook for a few seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the mustard and coriander seeds and let them cook for a few seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the ginger, garlic and chili and cook for a minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the ginger, garlic and chili and cook for a minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the onions, turmeric and a little salt and cook for 3-4 minutes stirring occasionally.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the onions, turmeric and a little salt and cook for 3-4 minutes stirring occasionally.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the potatoes, some more salt and mix well. Cover and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes, stirring every 5-6 minutes, until potatoes are well done.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the potatoes, some more salt and mix well. Cover and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes, stirring every 5-6 minutes, until potatoes are well done.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve hot topped with chopped cilantro leaves! Serve as part of meal with any lentil curry(Daal), or other soups/stews, Indian bread(Roti) and salad or any indian pickle.(my current favorite is the punjabi raw mango pickle)
